segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 3
1. Paṭhamavagga
8. Mallikāsutta
Sāvatthinidānaṃ.
Tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ uparipāsādavaragato hoti.
segments.en: Now at that time King Pasenadi of Kosala was upstairs in the stilt longhouse together with Queen Mallikā.

segments.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the king said to the queen,

segments.pli: “atthi nu kho te, mallike, kocañño attanā piyataro”ti?
segments.en: “Mallikā, is there anyone more dear to you than yourself?”

segments.pli: “Natthi kho me, mahārāja, kocañño attanā piyataro.
Tuyhaṃ pana, mahārāja, atthañño koci attanā piyataro”ti?
segments.en: But is there anyone more dear to you than yourself?”

segments.pli: “Mayhampi kho, mallike, natthañño koci attanā piyataro”ti.
Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo pāsādā orohitvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala came downstairs from the stilt longhouse, went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.

segments.pli: “idhāhaṃ, bhante, mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ uparipāsādavaragato mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavocaṃ:
‘atthi nu kho te, mallike, kocañño attanā piyataro’ti?
Evaṃ vutte, bhante, mallikā devī maṃ etadavoca:
‘natthi kho me, mahārāja, kocañño attanā piyataro.
Tuyhaṃ pana, mahārāja, atthañño koci attanā piyataro’ti?
Evaṃ vuttāhaṃ, bhante, mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavocaṃ:
‘mayhampi kho, mallike, natthañño koci attanā piyataro’”ti.
Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi:
segments.en: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha recited this verse:

segments.pli: “Sabbā disā anuparigamma cetasā,
segments.en: “Having explored every quarter with the mind,

segments.pli: Nevajjhagā piyataramattanā kvaci;
segments.en: one finds no-one dearer than oneself.

segments.pli: Evaṃ piyo puthu attā paresaṃ,
segments.en: Likewise for others, each holds themselves dear.

segments.pli: Tasmā na hiṃse paramattakāmo”ti.
segments.en: So one who loves themselves would not harm others.”

suttaplex.blurb: Pasandi asks Queen Mallikā who is most dear. They both agree that the one most dear is oneself, and the Buddha agrees.
